{{< entity_summary >}}
The Government of Canada spent an estimated **\$814.4K in 2021-2022** on contracts with INTERNATIONAL SAFETY RESEARCH.

Across 24 contracts active since the start of the 2017-2018 fiscal year, 9 have at least one amendment (38%). Of contracts with amendments, the average increase in dollar value was 73% and the average number of amendments was 1.89. Cumulatively these amendments represent an increase of \$2.9M over the original contract values.

The average contract duration was 2.14 years, and the average contract value (not including contracts under \$10k) was \$719.8K. The longest contract was 5.54 years. The largest contract by value (including amendments) was \$3.4M.

{{< /entity_summary >}}
